If there is no fix for these new changes, I'll have to switch browsers. I've put up with all of the changes to FF because there were workarounds through the userChrome.css file, but now I can't even get that to work to change these back to the way they worked for me.

Please tell me there is a fix. I don't have time to go back to a previous version and reload all my add-ons. This is the final straw for me. I've been using FF since 1.0, but this taking away all our choices is just unacceptable.

title: Turn ON initial suggestions when clicking in address bar
content:
With a recent Firefox update (within the last few weeks), the behavior of the address bar has changed. It used to be that when I click in the empty address bar in a new tab, a list of "top results" would pop into list under the bar. The list would typically consist of the pages that I most recently visit.

Now nothing happens when I click into the address bar. I have to actually start typing something for the suggestions window to pop up under the bar.

I found an older support question here where someone wanted to turn off this feature, and they were directed to a setting in about:config called browser.urlbar.openViewOnFocus. I just checked, and it seems this setting is no longer available.

Anyone know if this has been replaced with another setting that activates my desired functionality?

title: Search term in Apple Mail is appearing automatically in Find Text field in Firefox. Should I be worried?
content:
Today I was searching for an email in Apple Mail - I typed the name I was looking for in the search box in Mail and found the email. So far so good! Then I went to Firefox where I wanted to search for a particular piece of text in a webpage. When I clicked command-F the text search box opened, but the search term I'd input in mail was already there. (I didn't copy and paste at any stage in this). Concerned I went back to mail and changed the search term. Returning to Firefox the search term was also updated there. I can think of no reason why a search term from Mail would be passed to Firefox so I'm concerned my Mac has been hacked in some way. Any help appreciated.

Shane

title: php based web site no longer displays correctly in Firefox but is OK in other browsers
content:
I have a home website that was written using php well over 10 years ago. Except for family updates, it has changed little and displayed correctly using firefox and other browsers. Firefox is my preferred browser. A couple of months ago, it stopped displaying correctly in firefox but continues to display correctly w/o issues in Edge, and other browsers.

I note it displays in a basic form in firefox, links to other pages and content are shown and operable, but not displayed (correctly) as it does in Edge and others. I am on the latest version of Win Pro 10.

I posted the problem the end of August and received a number of suggestions. I went through the steps suggested (using troubleshoot amongst other suggestions) and none of the suggestions resolved the issue. My suspicion is that something in a relatively recent update of firefox has issues with my php based code. I do not use a "web tool" but write the source myself. I started writing websites with html decades ago and got the bug to use php years back.

If anyone has the interest (or curiosity) to look at the website in firefox and edge and my source code and see if they see the issue I would be glad provide the link to my website.

creator: deryder

title: Big problem with Firefox Browser compatibility
content:
Hi there I have been using Firefox for as long as I can remember. I am also a Supporter and have been for many years. I love using Firefox!

I am not by any means a techie, so all I am able to do is give you certain examples of what I have experienced and sadly (for me), I have been forced to use other browsers.

I have a MacBook Pro 16" 2020 with the latest software Updates.

I use Gmail for all my email and have done so for the pst 20 years. I have recently noticed that when I am replying to Gmail recipients using Firefox, there is a noticeable delay when typing each letter of the words. I am not that quick as a typist, but it is infuriating and distracting as the error appears, I correct it, and then the corrected word also appears. In other words, the delay is so long the word appears twice until I delete one of the words which now appears twice. I was advised to try a browser other than Firefox and I did this. The delays disappear when I switch to Google Chrome and with Safari.

I also subscribe to several news media editions most mornings. These editions also have Premium content articles which I used to be able to read without having to login to each premium article I wanted to read. These editions come from a newspaper group in South Africa which is a PLC. I read most morning newspapers from the UK, which is where I used to live and now recently from South Africa. The name of the Group is Arena Holdings and they own and publish most of the newspapers in South Africa.

I have been in contact with their IT department for the past two months, and after extensive investigation, they asked what browser I was using. It was of course Firefox. I was asked to change my browser to either Chrome or Safari and when I tried Chrome and Safari, the problem was solved.

Here I am as a last resort appealing to you for assistance. I don't want to leave Firefox, but the odds are not in my favour.

I have no idea if this is an iOS problem, an Apple problem or the providers. I was saddened to discover that when I used Chrome and Safari, the problems I experienced, which are detailed above, disappeared.

Please help me with what seems to be a compatibility issue problem. I do not want to end my long association with Firefox.

With sincere thanks


Edward Kahn
creator: tedkahn

title: make spell checker less obtuse to enable
content: I've seen other people round the net with the same problem I had. no spell check. it took way too much searching to find out why and how to fix it. even more confusing is on your languages page, it has language pack and dictionary together and no pointer that the language pack will not fix the spellchecker. why don't you just have dictionaries on one page? why don't you link to the dictionaries page from the settings menu where it says "check spelling as you type". this whole thing is so darn obtuse and there is really no reason for it to be. nobody should have to go through this much frustration just to get the darn spellchecker to work.
creator: tremault

title: Crashing causing search engine change
content:
Hi Guys, Firefox crashes now and then, and when it does, it changes my default search engine.

When this happens, "Browser Default" is added to 'search Shortcuts' and selected.

To revert back to Google, it has to be selected, and removed.

I have come to the conclusion, that this is a deliberate action, caused by some form of Malware or similar, as it is the only thing that appears to change, and always happens when Firefox crashes.

On the other rare occasions that Firefox crashes, it returns asking to return to previous sessions, and does so without issue - these crashes are extremely infrequent, however, the previous example is like clockwork.

Hoping you can help.

Cheers, Brad

Changing resolution does not work, it going back to 4K immediately. My PC is capable only for 1080p and my internet connection is not fast enough either. This makes Firefox mostly useless for watching Youtube because most new vids are 4K. I have looked at the settings from both Youtube and Firefox and I can't see anything wrong there.
creator: jyrimtlaitinen

title: Firefox searching in Google
content: I down loaded Firefox, and the search bar says I will be searching in Google. Is the way it works? Am I still protected by firefox when I search in Google?

title: Blocked PM and comment function
content: First, the problem does not occur using Chrome or Safari. On one site I visit regularly I am no longer able to use the PM and comment functions. I have checked with the site's webmaster and am confident the problem is not at their end. Suggestions short of deserting Firefox?

title: Firefox not syncing
content:
Hi
